message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.IR, cs.NE 

This paper is about automatic headline generation, which is a subfield of text summarization and sentence compression. The paper proposes a neural headline generation model that uses minimum risk training strategy to optimize model parameters with respect to evaluation metrics. This approach is related to natural language processing (NLP) and machine learning (ML), which are covered by several arXiv CS sub-categories. Based on the content of the paper, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which covers NLP and ML for text processing. Other likely sub-categories include cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), cs.IR (Information Retrieval), and cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing), which are also relevant to the paper's topic.
